title: Remove central question text and show only proposal buttons

requirements.text: Remove the central proposal/question headline text from the landing screen so that, before acceptance, the UI shows only the two existing call-to-action buttons (the evasive "No" button and the glowing "Yessss miss madam baby ji" button) over the existing floating-hearts background.

quotes: Remove the question text just keep the buttons

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load (when not accepted), there is no headline/question text rendered above or around the buttons.
The existing two-button layout remains functional: the "No" button still evades pointer/touch interaction and the "Yessss miss madam baby ji" button is still clickable.
Clicking the "Yessss miss madam baby ji" button still triggers the existing confetti effect and shows the existing heart-shaped reveal card.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor (no new services).
nonGoals: Do not change the existing button labels or behaviors.
Do not redesign the page theme, background animation, confetti, or heart reveal card beyond what is necessary to remove the headline text.
